item.title: Iron money: economic isolation on the Upper Peninsula frontier
item.description: These are fragmentary notes - and a few links - regarding the introduction of "iron money" into the economy of Marquette County, Michigan, and the controversy surrounding it leading up to the 1876 Presidential election. Timeline Panic of 1857. Panic of 1873. Newspaper accounts The New York Times was in 1876 a Republican newspaper, and did not have the reputation it maintains today as a "newspaper of record".  Tilden's Iron Currency, New York Times, July 19, 1876
